cinnamon.engine.object

Class BodyComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.system.ComponentManager.Component
      • cinnamon.engine.object.BodyComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copier<ComponentManager.Component>, Identifiable, Partitionable

    public final class BodyComponent
extends ComponentManager.Component
implements Partitionable

    A BodyComponent represents the 2D collision polygon for a GameObjectManager.GObject as well as a body for the Solver to manipulate during physics computations.

    The current collision detection algorithm is performed via SAT (Separating Axis Theorem) to accurately determine if a collision has taken place. For contact point generation, clipping is used with the separating axis of minimum translation found during the detection step.

    Information about a collision is stored in a Manifold that is given to #collidesWith(BodyComponent, CollisionManifold). This includes contact points, each point's penetration depth, and a unit collision normal facing in the direction of the BodyComponent that calls collidesWith (BodyComponent, Manifold) to the BodyComponent passed in as an argument.

    Aside from collision operations, BodyComponents also hold quantities used during physics computations in the Solver. These include (but are not limited to) mass, velocity, and coefficients of restitution and friction, the first two being measured in kilograms and meters per second, respectively.

    Toggles are available for disabling or enabling certain features such as collision with setCollidable(boolean).

    Both the SAT detection and contact point generation algorithms were originally learned from http://www.dyn4j .org/.
